lines.text: You better understand something here and now - what we did before, that was something happened - don't ask me how or why. But it's not going to happen again.
Well, why not?

[Yelling]
Don't you understand? I didn't *know* you then. I didn't *care* about you. But I *know* you now. I *LIKE* you.
Man, I end up with the...

[Angrily]
Look, why don't you sit down? I invited you to dinner, let's have DINNER.
Tell me something. That cook - that friend of yours in the restaurant business. Do you like him too the way you like me now, or don't you care about him the way you used to not care about me?
You know me in the cold weather - how I love to be in love. We are in love, aren't we? Really in love.
Yeah - you with yourself, and me with myself.
It seems very funny, putting you together with a family, somehow.
Well, what did you think - I got hatched out of an egg?

[about family]
That's what makes it rough - when they love you.

[in Barbie's apartment after he and Angie stayed the night there]
What are *you* doing here?
Payin' the rent, for one thing. Which brings me to little orphan Annie you parked here - incidentally without my permission, number one which I would not give you, number two over my dead body.
You know something, if you didn't try so hard to fight against it you could be a pretty decent kind of person.
Tell me something, that friend of yours, in the restaurant business. Do you like him the way you like me or do you not like him the way you used to not like me.
Dead dead you're dead!
Go, go where the wind blows you!

[on Angie's sexy dress]
Man, do you look wild.
Thank you.
No, I mean it - I really mean it.
Look how surprised he sounds.
You look so - what am I gonna tell 'ya? You look like a woman.
How can you manage to make even a compliment sound like a slap in the face?
What did I say? You look like a woman! I apologise - excuse me. You look like a man.
Would you like a drink?
Thank you
Scotch
Thank you

[pouring scotch]
Water, Soda or Tonic?

[a bit confused]
Scotch and Tonic? uh... very good...
[takes the glass from her]
Zelda, Gin and Tonic, yes. Vodka and Tonic, yes. Scotch and Tonic, no.

[confused]
uh...
water.

[lying on the couch]
oh, look how surprised she sounds?
[starts pulling Angie towards him]
What are you doing? as if I didn't know...
Come here Louis
Louis?
got a new kind of experiment

[after Rocky ask her out]
Well, I've got a date.

[puzzled]
With who?

[Angie bursts out laughing]
What's funny?
If I didn't know better, I'd swear you're my brother Dominick.

[listening to the song "Love with the Proper Stranger]
That's what love is - bells and banjos playing? How they brainwash you! And here I spend my whole life like a nut waiting for what? A stranger.

[after giving Rocky a black eye for getting Angie pregnant]
We had a long talk. And the thing is, he came to me like a man, and he's willing to marry 'ya.

[Bewildered]
WHY?
I know you're embarrassed, the stupid way he put it, but...
I'm not embarrassed. I'd like to know!
What do you mean "stupid?"
Stupid - you're STUPID.

[to a priest]
Is there *any* way you can make a person get married if they don't wanna? There must be a law or *something*.
Is there a way you can make a person get married, a law or something?
That's just wonderful - and I'm the medicine!
How are you?
Find and you?
Fine.
That's fine.
You look so... what am I gonna tell ya? you look like a women

[bursts out laughing]
how can you manage to make a compliment sound like a slap in the face?
What did I say? you look like a women. My apologies, excuse me, you look like a man.
I don't know what it is. First time in my life I come to see a girl, I feel like I'm 14 years old. Even when I was 14, I didn't feel like that.
In the old days, you did what you had to do. If you didn't like it... eh, you liked it anyway.
What happened today... nothing happened... what I'm I gonna tell you - I'm sick of the kind of life I'm leading?
You want me to find you a doctor! You want me to find you a doctor!
What's so terrible, give you ride home?
Its so embarrassing in a fruit truck all the time.
Excuse me Your Highness. When they start hauling vegetables in a limousines I'll pick you up in that.
If I wanna stay home, if I wanna blow bubbles I have a right to do what I like.
In America everyone have a right to do what they like but what do they like? They don't know what they like!
Ask him would he like a piece of cake or something.
Would you like a piece of cake or something?
Lets face it, you ever look at a married man - Prisoner of Zenda!
What are you looking at me for - do I look dead to you?
Do you want to get married?
I said I would didn't I?
That's not what I asked.
Who wants to get married?
